com.raweng.built

Class BuiltAnalytics

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.raweng.built.BuiltAnalytics

  • public class BuiltAnalytics
extends java.lang.Object
    The BuiltAnalytics class provides an interface to Built.io's analytics backend.
    Author:
    raw engineering, Inc

    • Method Detail

      • event

        public BuiltAnalyticsEvent event(java.lang.String eventId)
        Create BuiltAnalyticsEvent Instance.
        Parameters:
        eventId - event id string.
        Returns:
        BuiltAnalyticsEvent instance.

        Example :
         // 'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltApplication builtApplication = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");
 BuiltAnalyticsEvent bugEvent = builtApplication.analytics(context).event("create_bug");

      • setHeader

        public void setHeader(java.lang.String key,
             java.lang.String value)
        To set headers for Built.io Backend rest calls.
        Scope is limited to this object only.
        Parameters:
        key - header name.
        value - header value against given header name.

        Example :
         // 'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltAnalytics analytics = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b").analytics(context);
 analytics.setHeader("custom_header_key", "custom_header_value");

      • removeHeader

        public void removeHeader(java.lang.String key)
        Remove a header for a given key from headers.
        Scope is limited to this object only.
        Parameters:
        key - header key.

        Example :
         // 'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltAnalyticsEvent analytics = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b").analytics(context);
 analytics.removeHeader("custom_header_key");

      • cancelRequest

        public void cancelRequest()
        Request to cancel all analytics network requests.

        Example :
         analytics.cancelRequest();

      • setSuperProperties

        public void setSuperProperties(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> superProperties)
        Set Global Properties for all Events. Super properties, once registered automatically sent as properties for all event tracking calls.
        Parameters:
        superProperties -   HashMap object contains property name as key and its respective value as value.

        Example :
         // 'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltApplication builtApplication  = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");
 BuiltAnalytics      analytics = builtApplication.analytics(context);

 HashMap superProperties = new HashMap();
 superProperties.put("custom_key","custom_value");

 analytics.setSuperProperties(superProperties);

      • setBatchSize

        public void setBatchSize(int batchSize)
        Set triggering events size based on particular instance.
        Parameters:
        batchSize - batch size count.

        Example :
         // 'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltApplication builtApplication  = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");
 BuiltAnalytics      analytics      = builtApplication.analytics(context);

 analytics.setBatchSize(10);

      • trackAnonymously

        public void trackAnonymously(boolean isTrackAnonymous)
        Set True/False for enable/disable anonymous user track.
        Parameters:
        isTrackAnonymous - True/False value.

        Example :
         // 'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltApplication builtApplication  = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");
 BuiltAnalytics      analytics      = builtApplication.analytics(context);

 analytics.trackAnonymously(true);

      • getBatchSize

        public int getBatchSize()
        Get batch size count.

        Example :
         int batchSize = analytics.getBatchSize();

      • isTrackAnonymousEnable

        public boolean isTrackAnonymousEnable()
        Get track anonymous or not.

        Example :
         boolean isTrack = analytics.isTrackAnonymousEnable();

      • triggerEvents

        public void triggerEvents(java.util.ArrayList<BuiltAnalyticsEvent> builtEventArrayList)
        Triggers set of events based on the batchSize
        Parameters:
        builtEventArrayList - array list of BuiltAnalyticsEvent instance BuiltAnalyticsEvent event info.

        Example :
         // 'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltAnalytics analytics = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b").analytics(context);

 BuiltAnalyticsEvent bugEvent_1 = builtApplication.analytics(context).event("create_bug_1");
 BuiltAnalyticsEvent bugEvent_2 = builtApplication.analytics(context).event("create_bug_2");
 BuiltAnalyticsEvent bugEvent_3 = builtApplication.analytics(context).event("create_bug_3");

 ArrayList<BuiltAnalyticsEvent> arrayList = new  ArrayList<BuiltAnalyticsEvent>();
 arrayList.add(bugEvent_1);
 arrayList.add(bugEvent_2);
 arrayList.add(bugEvent_3);

 analytics.triggerEvents(arrayList);

      • triggerEventsImmediately

        public void triggerEventsImmediately(java.util.ArrayList<BuiltAnalyticsEvent> builtEventArrayList)
        Triggers set of events immediately .
        Parameters:
        builtEventArrayList - array list of BuiltAnalyticsEvent instance BuiltAnalyticsEvent event info.

        Example :
         // 'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltAnalytics analytics = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b").analytics(context);

 BuiltAnalyticsEvent bugEvent_1 = builtApplication.analytics(context).event("create_bug_1");
 BuiltAnalyticsEvent bugEvent_2 = builtApplication.analytics(context).event("create_bug_2");
 BuiltAnalyticsEvent bugEvent_3 = builtApplication.analytics(context).event("create_bug_3");

 ArrayList<BuiltAnalyticsEvent> arrayList = new  ArrayList<BuiltAnalyticsEvent>();
 arrayList.add(bugEvent_1);
 arrayList.add(bugEvent_2);
 arrayList.add(bugEvent_3);

 analytics.triggerEventsImmediately(arrayList);

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Flushing out application pending events. Use this method if user want to flush all the application pending event while app went background or terminating app then this method need to get called.

        Example :
         analytics.flush();

      • flushAll

        public static void flushAll()
        Flushing all pending events. Use this method if user want to flush all pending event while app went background or terminating app then this method need to get called.

        Example :
         BuiltAnalytics.flushAll();
